Thanks for catching that.  Problem was that we were trying to hyperlink to something in the preference dialog, non-existant in this mode.

Btw, do you ever use highlighters?  I don't...

(In reply to comment #1)
> Thanks for catching that.  Problem was that we were trying to hyperlink to
> something in the preference dialog, non-existant in this mode.
> 
> Btw, do you ever use highlighters?  I don't...

Actually I am. Two reasons: 

-- easier to see in Packages Explorer what task you currently working on when switching between several tasks.

-- easy to see tasks with some recent activities or tasks that belong to various components. I am bug fan of "UML Modelling in color" where you assign one out of 4 colors to selected subsystem or archetype depend on context. If I am not mistaken "Getting things done" suggesting similar idea with colored sticky notes...

BTW, it would be quite fancy to open task view as an editor that would show each task as "skicky note"... :-)
